They are usually said to be 8; ब्र ह्मी <lbinfo n='mAheSva#rI'/> माहेश्वरी चंडी वाराही वैष्णवी तथा । कौमारी चैव <lbinfo n='cA#muMqAcarciMketyazwa'/> चामुंडाचर्चिंकेत्यष्ट मातरः ॥ or, according to some, only seven; ब्राह्मी माहेश्वरी चैव कौमारी वैष्णवी तथा । माहेंद्री चैव वाराही <lbinfo n='cAmuM#qA'/> चामुंडा-सप्त मातरः ॥ Some increase the umber to sixteen. <b>--2</b> <ab>N.</ab> of eight classes of female ancestors or Manes. <i>--<ab>m.</ab></i> <b>1</b> A measurer. <b>--2</b> <ab>Ved.</ab> A maker, builder, creator. <b>--3</b> A knower, one having true <lbinfo n='know+ledge'/> knowledge. <b>--4</b> Life, or soul (जीव) [<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>L.</ab> <i>Mater</i>.] <b>--Comp.</b>  <lbinfo n='--ke#SawaH'/> --केशटः a maternal uncle. --गणः the collection of the divine mothers. --गंधिनी an unnatural mother.  <lbinfo n='--go#min'/> --गोमिन् <i><ab>m.</ab></i> one who has committed incest with his mother.  <lbinfo n='--go#traM'/> --गोत्रं a mother's family. --ग्रामः the female sex, womankind. --घातः, <lbinfo n='GA#takaH'/> --घातकः, --घातिन् <i><ab>m.</ab></i> --घ्नः a matricide --घातुकः {1} a matricide. {2} an <lbinfo n='epi+thet'/> epithet of Indra. --चक्रं the group of divine mothers. --देव <i><ab>a.</ab></i> having a mother for one's god, adoring <lbinfo n='mo+ther'/> mother like a god. --नंदनः an epithet of Kārtikeya. --पक्ष <i><ab>a.</ab></i> belonging to the mother's side or line. (--क्षः) maternal kinsmen. --पितृ <i><ab>m.</ab></i> (dual) (forming मातापितरौ or मातरपितरौ) parents. --पुत्रौ (मातापुत्रौ) a mother and son. --पूजनं worship of the divine mothers --बंधुः, --बांधवः a maternal kinsman; <ls>R. 12. 12.</ls> (--<ab>pl.</ab>) a class of relatives on the mother's side; they are thus <lbinfo n='speci+fied'/> specified: --मातुः पितुः स्वसुः पुत्रा मातुर्मातुः <lbinfo n='sva#suH'/> स्वसुः सुताः । मातुर्मातुलपुत्राश्च विज्ञेया मातृबंधवः ॥ --भोगीण <i><ab>a.</ab></i> fit to be enjoyed or possessed by a mother. --मंडलं the collection of the divine mothers. --मातृ <i><ab>f.</ab></i> an epithet of Pārvatī. --मुखः, --शासितः a foolish fellow. simpleton. --यज्ञः a sacrifice offered to the divine mothers. --वत्सलः an epithet of Kārtikeya. --स्वसृ <i><ab>f.</ab></i> (मातृष्वसृ or मातुःस्वसृ) a mother's sister, a maternal aunt. --स्वसेयः (मातृष्वसेयः) a mother's sister's son.             "content": "मातृ¦ <i>mātṛ</i> <ab>m.</ab> <i>(mā;</i> <ab>sfx.</ab> <i>tṛ)</i> mesureur, <ab>Vd.</ab> -- <ab>F.</ab> mère; || <ab>t.</ab> de respect en parlant à une femme âgée. || Vache. || La terre; || l'espace, le vide. || Mère divine ou énergie féminine d'un dieu, en <ab>gén.</ab> [on en compte 7, 8 ou 16]. || <ab>Gr.</ab> <lang n='greek'>μητήρ</lang>; <ab>lat.</ab> mater; <ab>lith.</ab> motc; <ab>germ.</ab> mutter; <ab>angl.</ab> mother; <ab>etc.</ab>  <P><i>matṛkachida</i> <ab>m.</ab> <i>(chid)</i> <s1 slp1='paraSurAma'>Paraśurāma</s1>.  <P><i>mātṛkā</i> <ab>f.</ab> (<ab>sfx.</ab> <i>ka)</i> mère; || nourrice; || mère divine. || Voyelle; son simple; alphabet. <lbinfo n='7'/>  <P><i>mātṛkeśaṭa</i> <ab>m.</ab> oncle maternel.  <P><i>mātṛgrāma</i> <ab>m.</ab> le sexe féminin, les femmes <lbinfo n='3'/> [<ab>m.</ab> àm. la collection des mères] <ab>Bd.</ab>  <P><i>mātṛghātuka</i> <ab>m.</ab> <i>(han;</i> <ab>sfx.</ab> <i>uka)</i> <s1 slp1='indra'>Indra</s1>, destructeur <lbinfo n='8'/> de Diti.  <P><i>mātṛmukha</i> <ab>m.</ab> lourdaud, niais.  <P><i>mātṛbandhu</i> <ab>m.</ab> parent par la mère.  <P><i>mātṛcāsita</i> <ab>m.</ab> <i>(śās)</i> niais.  <P><i>mātṛṣvasṛ</i> <ab>f.</ab> <i>(svasṛ)</i> sœur de la mère, tante maternelle.  <P><i>mātṛṣvaseya</i> <ab>m.</ab> [<ab>f.</ab> <i>ī</i>] cousin, cousine [par la sœur de la mère].  <P><i>mātṛṣvastrīya</i> <ab>m.</ab> [<ab>f.</ab> <i>ā</i>] <ab>mms.</ab>  <P><i>mātṛsiṃhī</i> <ab>f.</ab> <i>(siṃha)</i> justicia, <ab>bot.</ab>"

            "word": "मातृ",
            "eid": "6775",
            "pagenum": 1029,
            "content": "<b>mātṛ́,</b>¦ <ab>f.</ab> [<ls>Cu. 〔472〕</ls>], die <i>Mutter</i> [von <hom>1.</hom> mā 8, also als die Bildnerin des Kindes im Mutterleibe], so auch 2〉 von der Kuh als der Mutter des Kalbes, meist jedoch im bildlichen Sinne; häufig 3〉 mit dem <ab>Gen.</ab> des Kindes oder Kalbes; oder 4〉 mit den Correlaten: sūnú [Page1030] oder 5〉 putrá oder 6〉 gárbha oder śíśu {805,2}; {901,4}; {830,3} oder 7〉 vatsá, oder 8〉 mit dem Gegensatze pitṛ́. Im bildlichen Sinne wird 9〉 die Heilung (íṣkṛti) als Mutter der Kräuter (óṣadhīnām) oder 10〉 uṣás als Mutter der Kühe (gávām) <ab>d. h.</ab> der rothen Morgenlichter bezeichnet; 11〉 als die rastlosen Mütter der ewigen Ordnung (yahvī́ ṛtásya mātárā) erscheinen Nacht und Morgenröthe, Himmel und Erde und īm <ab>pl.</ab> die Kühe (Milch) die dem Soma zuströmen; 12〉 in dem letzteren Sinne auch ohne den Zusatz ṛtásya; 13〉 <ab>du.</ab>, mātárā die <i>Aeltern, Vater und Mutter</i> (<ab>vgl.</ab> pitárā) auch mit <ab>Gen.</ab>; 14〉 <i>Mütter,</i> als die alles nährenden, pflegenden, liebend umfassenden werden verschiedene Göttinnen, oder als solche gedachte Wesen <ab>z. B.</ab> die Wasser aufgefasst, auch in diesem Sinne bisweilen ({442,5}) mit dem <ab>Gen.</ab>; namentlich 15〉 die <i>Mutter</i> Erde pṛthivī́ mātā́, einmal auch bhū́mis mātā́ ({844,10}); 16〉 die mahī́ mātā́ die grosse, reiche <i>Mutter,</i> welche sich mit dem Strome des befruchtenden Regens auf die Erde niederlässt und mit ihr eins wird, und welche auch unter dem Bilde einer Kuh (<ab>vgl.</ab> mahī́ gaús), oder eines Stromes ({395,15}) dargestellt und als Mutter der Maruts ({507,3}) aufgefasst oder auch mit der áditi gleichgesetzt wird ({72,9}; {645,3}); so auch im Dual Himmel und Erde; 17〉 auch unter der Mutter des Indra scheint dieselbe Göttin verstanden. 18〉 Häufig erscheint die Mutter Erde (pṛthivī́ mātā́) neben dem Vater Himmel (dyaús pitā́); oder 19〉 <ab>du.</ab>, beide als <i>Aeltern</i> aller Wesen; 20〉 namentlich scheinen sie auch als Aeltern des Indra gefasst, und damit steht nicht im Widerspruche, dass Indra auch als Schöpfer des Himmels und der Erde bezeichnet wird, indem ja oft [<ab>z. B.</ab> {880,3}] von den Göttern gesagt wird, dass sie sich ihre Aeltern selbst geschaffen haben; 21〉 als Mutter des Agni erscheint zunächst das Holz, aus welchem durch Reiben mit dem härteren Holzstücke (dem Vater) das Feuer entzündet wird, daher beide Holzstücke als seine Aeltern (mātárā) bezeichnet werden, häufig jedoch mit deutlicher Anspielung auf Erde und Himmel als die Aeltern des himmlischen Agni. Einmal ({140,3}) erscheint in diesem Sinne mātárā als <ab>masc.</ab> — <ab>Vgl.</ab> trimātṛ́ <ab>u. s. w.</ab> <dvsn n='TS'>-ar [<ab>V.</ab>] 18〉 {492,5}; dyāvāpṛthivī́ … pítar mā́tar {185,11}. <dvsn n='TS'>-ā́ {369,4} (〰 ‿iva). — 2〉 {164,9}; sometimes 16, <ab>viz.</ab> <s1 slp1='gOrI'>Gaurī</s1>, <s1 slp1='padmA'>Padmā</s1>, <s1 slp1='SacI'>Śacī</s1>, <s1 slp1='meDA'>Medhā</s1>, <s1 slp1='sAvitrI'>Sāvitrī</s1>, <s1 slp1='vijayA'>Vijayā</s1>, <s1 slp1='jayA'>Jayā</s1>, <s1 slp1='deva-senA'>Deva-senā</s1>, <s1 slp1='sva-DA'>Sva-dhā</s1>, <s1 slp1='svAhA'>Svāhā</s1>, <s1 slp1='SAnti'>Śānti</s1>, <s1 slp1='puzwi'>Puṣṭi</s1>, <s1 slp1='Dfti'>Dhṛti</s1>, <s1 slp1='tuzwi'>Tuṣṭi</s1>, <s1 slp1='Atma-devatA'>Ātma-devatā</s1> and <s1 slp1='kula-devatA'>Kula-devatā</s1>; they are closely connected with the worship of <s1 slp1='Siva'>Śiva</s1> and are described as attending on his son <s1 slp1='skanda'>Skanda</s1> or <s1 slp1='kArttikeya'>Kārttikeya</s1>, to whom at first only 7 <s1 slp1='mAtf'>Mātṛ</s1>s were assigned, but later an innumerable number; also the 13 wives of <s1 slp1='kaSyapa'>Kaśyapa</s1> are called, लोकानाम् मातरः), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Pur.</ls>; <ls>Hcat.</ls> (<ls>RTL. 222</ls> &c.)<info lex='inh'/>"

            "content": "मातृ ¦ [<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Gk.</ab>, <lang n='greek'>μάτηρ</lang>, <lang n='greek'>μήτηρ</lang>; <ab>Lat.</ab> <etym>mater</etym>; <ab>Lith.</ab> <etym>motė́</etym>; <ab>Slav.</ab> <etym>mati</etym>; <ab>Germ.</ab> <etym>muotar</etym>, <etym>Mutter</etym>; <ab>Eng.</ab> <etym>mother</etym>.]"

    "MW72": [
        {
            "word": "मातृ",
            "eid": "36815",
            "pagenum": 764,
            "content": "<i>Mātṛ, tā, trī, tṛ,</i>¦ a measurer (cf. <i>dhānya-m°;</i> in Nirukta XI. 5, the moon is called <i>mātā,</i> ‘the measurer’); a maker, former, creator, arranger, preparer (Ved.); a knower, one who infers correctly or has true knowledge <i>(= jñātṛ, pra-mātṛ); (tā),</i> m., N. of a particular mixed caste; N. of an author; (<i>tā</i>), f. (nom. du. <i>mātărau,</i> nom. pl. <i>mātăras,</i> acc. pl. <i>mātṝs,</i> see Gram. 129), the maker (of the child in the womb, cf. <i>jā-mātṛ</i>); a mother (sometimes at the end of adj. comps., e. g. <i>Kuntī-m°,</i> having Kuntī for a mother, i. e. son of Kuntī); ‘mother’ as a respectful term used in addressing females, near relatives, and elderly women generally; mother earth [cf. Ṛg-veda 1. 89, 4, V. 42, 16]; a cow (<i>= go,</i> a cow being sometimes called <i>lokasya</i> <i>mātā,</i> mother of the world); space, ether, the firmament [cf. <i>mātari-śvan</i>]; epithet of Lakṣmī (?); epithet of Durgā; N. of Dākṣāyaṇī in Siddhapura (also read Siddha-vana) and Kāyāvarohaṇa; (<i>tarā</i>), du., Ved. the two parents, father and mother; epithet of heaven and earth; epithet of the two pieces of wood used in kindling fire (regarded as the parents of Agni, who is called <i>dvi-mātṛ,</i> having two mothers; in this sense also <i>mātaras,</i> pl.); (<i>taras</i>), f. pl. the divine mothers or personified energies of the principal deities (sometimes reckoned as seven in number, viz. Brāhmī or Brahmāṇī, Māheśvarī, Kaumārī, Vaiṣṇavaī, Vārāhī, Indrāṇī or Aindrī or Māhendrī, Cāmuṇḍā; sometimes eight, viz. Brāhmī, Māheśvarī, Raudrī, Vārāhī, Vaiṣṇavī, Kaumārī, Carma-muṇḍā, Kāla-saṅkarṣiṇī; sometimes nine, viz. Brahmāṇī, Vaiṣṇavī, Raudrī, Vārāhī, Nārasiṃhikā, Kaumārī, Māhendrī, Cāmuṇḍā, Caṇḍikā; sometimes sixteen, viz. Gaurī, Padmā, Śacī, Medhā, Sāvitrī, Vijayā, Jayā, Deva-senā, Svadhā, Svāhā, Śānti, Puṣṭi, Dhṛti, Tuṣṭi, Ātma-devatā, Kula-devatā; these divine mothers being closely connected with the worship of the god Śiva and attending on his son Skanda or Kārttikeya, to whom at first only seven Mātṛs were assigned, but in the later mythology an innumerable number, who are sometimes represented as having displaced the original divine mothers); N. of eight classes of female ancestors or female Manes (mothers, grandmothers, greatgrandmothers, paternal and maternal aunts, &c.); according to Naigh. 1. 13, <i>mātaraḥ = nadī,</i> a river, [cf. Ṛg-veda III. 9, 2, where the waters are also called <i>mātaraḥ,</i> mothers; cf. also 1. 34, 8, where the seven rivers, Gaṅgā &c., are called <i>sapta-mātṛ;</i> according to native lexicographers <i>mātṛ</i> has also the following senses, <i>vi-bhūti, revatī, ākhukarṇī, in-</i> <i>dra-vāruṇī, mahā-śrāvaṇī, jaṭā-māṃsī:</i> cf. Gr. <lang n='greek'>μήτηρ,</lang> Dor. <lang n='greek'>μάτηρ;</lang> Lat. <nsi>mater;</nsi> Old Germ. <nsi>muotar;</nsi> Old Slav. <nsi>mati;</nsi> Lith. <nsi>mote;</nsi> Hib. <nsi>ma-</nsi> <nsi>thair.</nsi>] <i>—Mātara-pitarau,</i> m. du. mother and father, parents. <i>—Mātari-puruṣa, as,</i> m. a man (who acts or speaks) against his mother, a cowardly bully; [cf. <i>pitari-śūra.</i>] <i>—Mātari-śva</i> (fr. the next), <i>as,</i> m. a proper N. <i>—Mātari-śvan, ā,</i> m. (according to Sāy. on Ṛg-veda III. 29, 11, fr. <i>mātari = antarikṣe,</i> in the atmosphere, + <i>śvasiti</i> <i>= ceṣṭate,</i> breathes or moves; or according to others fr. <i>mātari</i> + rt. <i>śvi</i>), N. of a divine being described in Ṛg-veda 1. 60, 1, &c. as bringing down the hidden Agni to the Bhṛgus, and identified by Sāy. on Ṛg-veda 1. 93, 6, &c. with Vāyu, the Wind; N. of Agni himself, (according to Sāy. on Ṛg-veda 1. 96, 4, so called as <i>sarvasya jagato</i> <i>nirmātary antarikṣe śvasan vartamāṇaḥ</i>); air, wind, breeze (personified in Mahā-bh. Udyoga-p. 3599 as son of Garuḍa); N. of a Ṛṣi. <i>—Mātā-</i> <i>pitṛ, tarau,</i> m. du. mother and father, parents; [cf. Pāṇ. VI. 3, 32.] <i>—Mātā-pitṛ-vihīna, as, ā, am,</i> bereft of father and mother, without father or mother. <i>—Mātā-putra, au,</i> m. du. mother and son. <i>—Mātā-</i> <i>maha, as,</i> m. a maternal grandfather; (<i>ī</i>), f. a maternal grandmother; (<i>au</i>), m. du. a grandfather and grandmother on the mother's side; (<i>ās</i>), m. pl. a mother's father, grandfather, and ancestors; <i>(as, ī,</i> <i>am), = mātāmahīya</i> below. <i>—Mātāmahīya, as, ā,</i> <i>am,</i> related or belonging to a maternal grandfather. <i>—Mātuḥ-śvasṛ</i> or <i>mātuḥ-svasṛ, ā,</i> f. a mother's sister, maternal aunt; [cf. <i>mātṛ-ṣvasṛ.</i>] <i>—Mātṛ-</i> <i>ka-cchida, as,</i> m. ‘the cutter off of his mother's head,’ an epithet of Paraśu-Rāma. <i>—Mātṛ-kṛta,</i> <i>as, ā, am,</i> done or performed towards a mother; done by a mother. <i>—Mātṛ-keśaṭa, as,</i> m. a mother's brother, maternal uncle. <i>—Mātṛ-gaṇa, as,</i> m. the assemblage of divine mothers (as worshipped in an especial manner in the western parts of India). <i>—Mātṛ-gandhinī,</i> f. ‘having but the smell (i. e. the name) of mother,’ an unnatural mother. <i>—Mā-</i> <i>tṛ-garbha, as,</i> m. a mother's womb. <i>—Mātṛgar-</i> <i>bha-stha, as, ā, am,</i> being in the mother's womb. <i>—Mātṛ-gāmin, ī,</i> m. ‘going to a mother,’ one who has committed incest with his mother. <i>—Mātṛ-</i> <i>gupta, as,</i> m., N. of a king. <i>—Mātṛguptābhi-</i> <i>ṣeṇana (°ta-abh°), am,</i> n. an expedition against Mātṛ-gupta. <i>—Mātṛ-gotra, am,</i> n. a mother's family; (<i>as, ā, am</i>), belonging to a mother's family. <i>—Mātṛ-grāma, as,</i> m. the aggregate of mothers, i. e. the female sex, womankind; N. of a village. <i>—Mātṛ-ghāta</i> or <i>mātṛ-ghātaka, as,</i> or <i>mātṛ-</i> <i>ghātin, ī,</i> or <i>mātṛ-ghna, as,</i> m. one who kills his mother, a matricide. <i>—Mātṛ-ghātuka, as,</i> m. a matricide; an epithet of Indra. <i>—Mātṛ-cakra, am,</i> n. a kind of mystical circle, an astrological figure; the circle or assemblage of divine mothers. <i>—Mātṛ-</i> <i>cakra-pramathana, as,</i> m. ‘afflicter of the circle of divine mothers (?),’ an epithet of Viṣṇu. <i>—Mā-</i> <i>tṛ-ceṭa, as,</i> m. a proper N. <i>—Mātṛ-tama, as, ā,</i> <i>am,</i> Ved. very motherly or maternal (said of the waters; according to Sāy. <i>= mātṛ-vaj jagatāṃ</i> <i>hita-kārin</i>). <i>—Mātṛ-tas,</i> ind. on the mother's side, in right of the mother. <i>—Mātṛ-tā,</i> f. maternity, the state of a mother, the being a mother. <i>—Mātṛ-</i> <i>tīrtha, am,</i> n., N. of a Tīrtha. <i>—Mātṛ-datta, as,</i> m. ‘mother-given,’ N. of a man; (<i>ā</i>), f., N. of a woman. <i>—Mātṛ-dattīya,</i> N. of a work. <i>—Mātṛ-</i> <i>deva, as,</i> m. having a mother for one's god. <i>—Mā-</i> <i>tṛ-doṣa, as,</i> m. the defect or inferiority of a mother (who is of a lower caste, Manu X. 14). <i>—Mātṛ-nandana, as,</i> m. ‘mother's joy,’ an epithet of Kārttikeya. <i>—Mātṛ-nāman, a,</i> n., scil. <i>sūkta,</i> epithet of a class of sacred texts in the Atharva-veda; (<i>ā</i>), m., N. of the reputed author and deity of these texts; (<i>ā, mnī, a</i>), named after the mother; [cf. <i>pitṛ-nāman.</i>] <i>—Mātṛ-nivātam,</i> ind. to a mother's shelter or protection, to a mother's side (Pāṇ. VI. 2, 8). <i>—Mātṛ-pakṣa, as, ā, am,</i> relating to the mother, belonging to the maternal line. <i>—Mātṛ-pālita, as,</i> n., N. of a Dānava. <i>—Mātṛ-pitṛ-kṛtābhyāsa (°ta-abh°), as, ā, am,</i> trained or exercised by one's father and mother. <i>—Mātṛ-pūjana, am,</i> n. the worship of the divine mothers. <i>—Mātṛ-bandhu, us,</i> m. a relation on the mother's side; (<i>u</i>), n. blood relationship on the mother's side. <i>—Mātṛ-bandhū, ūs,</i> f. a mother only in name, an unnatural mother; [cf. <i>brahma-</i> <i>bandhu.</i>] <i>—Mātṛ-bāndhava, as,</i> m. a relation on the mother's side. <i>—Mātṛ-bhāva, as,</i> m. the state or condition of a mother, maternity. <i>—Mātṛ-bheda-</i> <i>tantra, am,</i> n., N. of a Tantra. <i>—Mātṛ-bhogīṇa,</i> <i>as, ā, am,</i> fit or proper to be possessed by a mother; [cf. Scholiast on Pāṇ. V. 1, 9.] <i>—Mātṛ-</i> <i>maṇḍala, am,</i> n. the assemblage or company of divine mothers. <i>—Mātṛmaṇḍala-vid, t,</i> m. a priest of the Mātṛs. <i>—Mātṛ-mat, ān, atī, at,</i> Ved. possessing a mother, accompanied by a mother, having a mother. <i>—Mātṛ-mātṛ, tā,</i> f. ‘the mother of mothers,’ an epithet of Pārvatī. <i>—Mātṛ-mukha,</i> <i>as,</i> m. ‘mother-faced,’ a simple or foolish man, simpleton. <i>—Mātṛ-mṛṣṭa, as, ā, am,</i> adorned by a mother. <i>—Mātṛ-modaka,</i> N. of Uvaṭa's commentary on the Vājasaneyi-saṃhitā. <i>—Mātṛ-yajña</i> or <i>mātṛ-yāga, as,</i> m. a sacrifice or oblation to the Mātṛs. <i>—Mātṛ-vat,</i> ind. as a mother, like a mother, as towards a mother. <i>—Mātṛ-vatsala, as,</i> m. ‘mother-loving,’ an epithet of Kārttikeya. <i>—Mātṛ-</i> <i>vadha, as,</i> m. the murder of a mother, matricide. <i>—Mātṛ-vartin, ī, inī, i,</i> behaving well to a mother, dutiful to one's mother; (<i>ī</i>), m. a proper N. <i>—Mātṛ-vāhin, ī, inī, i,</i> carrying one's mother; (<i>inī</i>), f. a kind of bird <i>(= valgulā)</i>. <i>—Mātṛ-vidū-</i> <i>ṣita, as, ā, am,</i> tainted by the mother, inheriting a taint through the mother. <i>—Mātṛ-śāsita, as,</i> m. a man who is led or guided by his mother, a simpleton. <i>—Mātṛ-ṣaṣṭha, as, ī, am,</i> having a mother as a sixth person, six with a mother or inclusively of a mother. <i>—Mātṛ-ṣvasṛ, ā,</i> f. (also incorrectly <i>mātṛ-svasṛ</i>), a mother's sister, maternal aunt. <i>—Mātṛṣvaseya, as,</i> m. the son of a maternal aunt, a mother's sister's son; (<i>ī</i>), f. a mother's sister's daughter, the daughter of a maternal aunt. <i>—Mātṛ-ṣvasrīya, as,</i> m. a mother's sister's son, the son of a maternal aunt; (<i>ā</i>), f. a mother's sister's daughter. <i>—Mātṛ-siṃhī,</i> f. the plant Justicia Gendarussa. <i>—Mātṛ-han, ā,</i> m. (said to be Ved.), murderer of his own mother, a matricide. <i>—Mātrī-</i> <i>kṛ,</i> cl. 8. P. <i>-karoti, -kartum,</i> to adopt as a mother, see Scholiast on Pāṇ. VII. 4, 27."
        },
        {
            "word": "मातृ",
            "eid": "36958",
            "pagenum": 768,
            "content": "मातृ¦ <i>mātṛ.</i> See p. 764, col. 3."
        }
    ],
    "PUI": [
        {
            "word": "मातृ",
            "eid": "10581",
            "pagenum": 2,
            "content": "<i>Mātṛs</i>¦ — a Deva gaṇa;<sup>1</sup> fought with Utkala in the Devāsura war, but were put to flight by Kṛṣṇa.<sup>2</sup> <F>1) Vā. 72. 50.</F> <F>2) Bhā. II. 10. 38; VI. 8. 25; VIII. 10. 33; X. 63. 11.</F>"
        }
    ],
    "SHS": [
        {
            "word": "मातृ",
            "eid": "31214",
            "pagenum": 562,
            "content": "मातृ¦ f. (-ता) 1. A mother. 2. A divine mother, the personified energy of a deity or his wife; in a figurative sense, a mother to mortals; eight divine Mātris are enumerated, BRĀHMĪ, the Mātri of BRAHMĀ; MAHEŚWARĪ, the Mātri of ŚIVA; VAISHNAVĪ, of VISHṆU; AINDRĪ, of INDRA; VĀRĀHĪ, of VISHṆU, as the Varāha Avatār; KAUMĀRĪ, of KĀRTIKEYA; KAUVERĪ or CHĀMUNDĀ of KUVERA, and CHARCHIKĀ of ŚIVA, in one of his minor incarnations; another list calls them MAHEŚWARĪ, BRĀHMĪ, NĀRĀYANĪ, AINDRĪ, VARĀHĪ, KAUMĀRĪ, NARASĪNHĪ, and APARĀJITĀ, differing from the preceding one in the two last names, the first one of which, is the energy of VISHṆU in the Narasinha Avatār, and the latter a form of DURGĀ; another enumeration makes the Mātris sixteen, and another but seven. 3. A cow. 4. A female of the Brāhmana tribe, or the wife of a Brāhman. 5. The earth. 6. A name of LAKSHMĪ. 7. A name of REVATĪ. 8. Space, ether. E. मान to respect, Unādi aff. तृच्, and the final of the radical rejected."
        }
    ],
    "STC": [
        {
            "word": "मातृ",
            "eid": "16658",
            "pagenum": 562,
            "content": "<b>mātṛ-</b>¦ <ab>f.</ab> mère (aussi usité comme mode d'interpellation à des femmes d'un certain âge ou rang) ; Lakṣmī ; <ab>pl.</ab> Mères divines, énergies  des dieux ou génies femelles ; <i>-tas</i> du côté maternel ; <i>-vat</i> comme une mère.  <P><i>°gaṇa-</i> <ab>m.</ab> assemblée des Mères.  <P><i>°gandhinī-</i> <ab>f.</ab> qui n'a de la mère que l'apparence.  <P><i>°gṛha-</i> <ab>nt.</ab> sanctuaire des Mères divines.  <P><i>°ghātaka-</i> <ab>m.</ab> matricide.  <P><i>°cakra-</i> <ab>nt.</ab> cercle des Mères.  <P><i>°datta-</i> <ab>m.</ab> <ab>n.</ab> d'un homme ; <i>-ā-</i> <ab>f.</ab> d'une femme.  <P><i>°deva-</i> <ab>a.</ab> pour qui sa mère est une divinité.  <P><i>°doṣa-</i> <ab>m.</ab> infériorité d'une mère.  <P><i>°pālita-</i> <ab>m.</ab> <ab>n.</ab> d'un Dānava.  <P><i>°bandhū-</i> <ab>a.</ab> <ab>f.</ab> qui n'est mère que de <ab>nom.</ab>  <P><i>°bhakti-</i> <ab>f.</ab> dévotion à une mère.  <P><i>°maṇḍala-</i> <ab>nt.</ab> cercle des Mères.  <P><i>°vaṃśya-</i> <ab>a.</ab> qui appartient à la famille de la mère.  <P><i>°vatsala-</i> <ab>a.</ab> qui aime sa mère.  <P><i>°vidūṣita-</i> <ab>a. v.</ab> souillé par sa mère.  <P><i>°ṣvasṛ-</i> <ab>f.</ab> sœur de la mère.  <P><i>°ṣvaseya-</i> <ab>m.</ab> fils de la sœur de la mère ; <i>-ī-</i> <ab>f.</ab>  <P><i>mātā-duhitṛ-</i> <ab>f.</ab> <ab>du.</ab> mère et fille.  <P><i>°pitṛ-</i> <ab>m.</ab> <ab>du.</ab> père et mère, parents.  <P><i>°putra-</i> <ab>m.</ab> <ab>du.</ab> mère et fils.  <P><i>°maha-</i> <ab>m.</ab> grand'père maternel ; <ab>f.</ab> <i>-ī- ;</i> <ab>a.</ab> (<ab>f.</ab> <i>-ī-</i>) relatif au grand'père maternel."
        }
    ],
    "VEI": [
        {
            "word": "मातृ",
            "eid": "2444",
            "pagenum": 2,
            "content": "<b>Mātṛ</b>¦ is the regular word for ‘mother’ from the Rigveda onwards,<sup>1</sup> being a formation probably developed under the influence of an onomatopœtic word <i>mā,</i><sup>2</sup> used like Ambā<sup>3</sup> and <b>Nanā.</b><sup>4</sup> <dvsn n='P'/>The relations of wife and husband, as well as of mother and children, are treated under <b>Pati.</b> It remains only to add that details are given in the Sūtras<sup>5</sup> of the respectful attention paid to a mother, and of the ceremonies in which she is concerned. The mother also appears interested in the fate of her children as in the story of the sale of <b>Śunaḥśepa</b> for adoption by <b>Viśvāmitra</b> in the Aitareya Brāhmaṇa.<sup>6</sup> <dvsn n='P'/>In the household the mother ranked after the father (see <b>Pitṛ</b>). Occasionally <i>mātarā</i> is used for ‘parents,’ as are also <i>pitarā</i> and <i>mātarā pitarā</i><sup>7</sup> and <i>mātā-pitaraḥ.</i><sup>8</sup> <F>1) i. 24, 1; vii. 101, 3, etc.; Vājasaneyi Saṃhitā, xiii. 21, etc.; Aitareya Brāhmaṇa, ii. 6, etc.</F> <F>2) Böhtlingk and Roth, St. Petersburg Dictionary, <i>s.v.,</i> note.</F> <F>3) <i>Cf.</i> <i>ambe ambike ambalike,</i> Vājasaneyi Saṃhitā, xxiii. 18, with variations in Taittirīya Saṃhitā, vii. 4, 19, 1; Maitrāyaṇī Saṃhitā, iii. 12, 20; Taittirīya Brāhmaṇa, iii. 9, 6, 3; also <i>ambā ambāyavī, ambayā,</i> in the Kauṣītaki Upaniṣad, i. 3.</F> <F>4) Rv. ix. 112, 3 (<b>Upalaprakṣiṇī</b>). See von Schroeder, <i>Mysterium und Mimus,</i> 412.</F> <F>5) <i>Cf.</i> Delbrück, <i>Die indogermanischen</i> <i>Verwandtschaftsnamen,</i> 460, 476, 477.</F> <F>6) vii. 18 <i>seq. Cf.</i> also Leist, <i>Altarisches</i> <i>Jus Gentium,</i> 104; Jolly, <i>Die Adoption in</i> <i>Indien,</i> 16, 17.</F> <F>7) Rv. iii. 33, 3; vii. 2, 5, etc. For <i>mātarā pitarā,</i> see Rv. iv. 6, 7; Vājasaneyi Saṃhitā, ix. 19.</F> <F>8) Taittirīya Saṃhitā, i. 3, 10, vi. 3, 11, 3.</F>"
        }
    ],

            "word": "मातृ",
            "eid": "30137",
            "pagenum": 655,
            "content": "मातृ¦ f. (-ता) .²1 A mother. .²2 A divine mother, the personified energy of a deity or his wife; in a figurative sense, a mother to mortals; eight divine <i>Mātṛs</i> are enumerated, BRĀHMĪ, the <i>Mātṛ</i> of BRAHMĀ; MAHEŚVARĪ, the <i>Mātṛ</i> of ŚIVA; VAIṢṆAVĪ, of VIṢṆU; AINDRĪ, of INDRA; VĀRĀHĪ, of VIṢṆU, as the <i>Varāha Avatāra;</i> KAUMĀRĪ, of KĀRTTIKEYA; KĀVERĪ or CĀMUṆḌĀ of KUVERA, and CARCIKĀ of ŚIVA, in one of his minor incarnations; another list calls them MAHEŚVARĪ, BRĀHMĪ, NĀRĀYAṆĪ, AINDRĪ, VĀRĀHĪ, KAUMĀRĪ, NARASIṂHĪ, and APARĀJITĀ, differing from the preceding one in the two last names, the first one of which, is the energy of VIṢṆU in the <i>Narasiṃha Avatāra,</i> and the latter a form of DURGĀ; another enumeration makes the <i>Mātṛs</i> sixteen, and another but seven. .²3 A cow. .²4 A female of the <i>Brahman</i> tribe, or the wife of a <i>Brahman.</i> .²5 The earth. .²6 A name of LAKṢMĪ. .²7 A name of REVATĪ. .²8 Space, ether. .E. मान to respect, Uṇādi aff. तृच्, and the final of the radical rejected."

    "VCP": [
        {
            "word": "मातृ",
            "eid": "38095",
            "pagenum": "4747,b",
            "content": "मातृ¦ त्रि० मा--वृच् । १ प्रमाणकर्त्तरि २ परिमाणकर्त्तरि ३ जीवे ४ आकाशे च मातरिश्वा । मातारौ मातारः । मा--तृ । “ब्राह्मी माहेश्वरी चण्डी वाराही वैष्णवी तथा । कौमारी चैव चामुण्डा चर्चिकेत्यष्ट मातरः” इत्युक्ते ५ शिवसहचरीभेदे । ६ जनन्याम् ७ भूमौ ८ विभूतौ शब्दर० । ९ लक्ष्म्याम् हेमच० १० रेवत्याम् अमरः ११ स्त्री गव्यां मेदि० १२ आखुकर्ण्याम् १३ इन्द्रवारुण्याम् (राखालशशा) १४ जटामांस्यां राजनि० । चण्डीप्रसिद्धासु १५ देवीशक्तिषु च । “मातॄः कोपमयाविष्टः” देवीमा० । आतिदेशिकमातरश्च ब्रह्मवै० पु० गण० ख० १५ अ० उक्ता यथा “स्तन्यदात्री गर्भधात्री भक्ष्यधात्री गुरुप्रिया । अभीष्टदेवपत्नी च पितुः पत्नी च कन्यका । सगर्भजा या भगिनी पुत्रपत्नी प्रियाप्रसूः । मातुर्माता पितुर्माता सोदरस्य० प्रिया तथा । मातुः पितुश्च भगिनी मातुलानी तथैव च । जनानां वेदविहिता मातरः षोडश स्मृताः” । ब्रह्मवै० पु० जन्मख० ५९ अ० अन्यविधा उक्ता यथा “गुरुपत्नी राजपत्नी देवपत्नी तथा बधूः । पित्रोः स्वसा शिष्यपत्नी भृत्यपत्नी च मातुली । पितृपत्नी भ्रातृपत्नो श्वश्रूश्च भगिनीसुता । गर्भधात्रीष्टदेवी च पुंसः षोडश मातरः” । तत्रैव २५ अ० “गुरोःपत्नी राजपत्नी विप्रपत्नी च या सती । पत्नी च भ्रातृसुतयोर्मित्रपत्नी च तत्प्रसूः । प्रसूः पित्रोस्तयोर्भ्रातुःपत्नी श्वश्रूः स्वकन्यका । जननी तत्सपत्नी च भगिनी सुरभी तथा । स्वाभीष्टसुरपत्नी च धात्री कान्ता प्रदायिका । गर्भधात्री स्वनाम्नी च भयात्रातुश्च कामिनी । एता वेदप्रणीताश्च सर्वेषां मातरः स्मृतः” । अस्य रूपं मातरौ मातरः । वृद्ध्यादौ पूज्यासु गौर्य्यादिषु १६ देवीशक्तिभेदेषु “गौरी पद्मा शची मेधा सावित्री विजया जया । देवसेना स्वधा स्वाहा मातरो लोकमातरः । शान्तिः पुष्टिर्धृतिस्तुष्टिरात्मदेवतया सह” शु० त० गृह्यपु० ।"
        }

            "word": "मातृ",
            "content": "<li class=\"dict-entry\"><span lang=\"sa\">मातृ त्रि° मा—वृच् । <div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>१</b> प्रमाणकर्त्तरि <div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>२</b> परिमाणकर्त्तरि <div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>३</b> जीवे <div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>४</b> आकाशे च मातरिश्वा । मातारौ मातारः । मा—तृ । <q>ब्राह्मी माहेश्वरी चण्डी वाराही वैष्णवी तथा । कौमारी चैव चामुण्डा चर्चिकेत्यष्ट मातरः</q> इत्युक्ते <div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>५</b> शिवसहचरीभेदे । <div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>६</b> जनन्याम् <div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>७</b> भूमौ <div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>८</b> विभूतौ शब्दर° । <div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>९</b> लक्ष्म्याम् हेमच° <div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>१°</b> रेवत्याम् अमरः <div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>११</b> स्त्री गव्यां मेदि° <div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>१२</b> आखुकर्ण्याम् <div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>१३</b> इन्द्रवारुण्याम् (रा­खालशशा) <div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>१४</b> जटामांस्यां राजनि° । चण्डीप्रसिद्धासु <div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>१५</b> देवीशक्तिषु च । <q>मातॄः कोपमयाविष्टः</q> देवीमा° । आतिदेशिकमातरश्च ब्रह्मवै° पु° गण° ख° १५ अ° उक्ता यथा <q>स्तन्यदात्री गर्भधात्री भक्ष्यधात्री गुरुप्रिया । अभीष्ट­देवपत्नी च पितुः पत्नी च कन्यका । सगर्भजा या भगिनी पुत्रपत्नी प्रियाप्रसूः । मातुर्माता पितुर्माता सोदरस्य° प्रिया तथा । मातुः पितुश्च भगिनी मातु­लानी तथैव च । जनानां वेदविहिता मातरः षो­डश स्मृताः</q> । ब्रह्मवै° पु° जन्मख° ५९ अ° अन्यविधा उक्ता यथा <q>गुरुपत्नी राजपत्नी देवपत्नी तथा बधूः । पित्रोः स्वसा शिष्यपत्नी भृत्यपत्नी च मातुली । पितृपत्नी भ्रातृपत्नो श्वश्रूश्च भगिनीसुता । गर्भधात्रीष्टदेवी च पुंसः षो­डश मातरः</q> । तत्रैव २५ अ° <q>गुरोःपत्नी राजपत्नी विप्रपत्नी च या सती । पत्नी च भ्रातृसुतयोर्मित्रपत्नी च तत्प्रसूः । प्रसूः पित्रोस्तयोर्भ्रातुःपत्नी श्वश्रूः स्व­कन्यका । जननी तत्सपत्नी च भगिनी सुरभी तथा । स्वाभीष्टसुरपत्नी च धात्री कान्ता प्रदायिका । गर्भधात्री स्वनाम्नी च भयात्रातुश्च कामिनी । एता वेदप्रणीताश्च सर्वेषां मातरः स्मृतः</q> । अस्य रूपं मातरौ मातरः । वृद्ध्यादौ पूज्यासु गौर्य्यादिषु <div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>१६</b> देवीशक्तिभेदेषु <q>गौरी पद्मा शची मेधा सावित्री विजया जया । देवसेना स्वधा स्वाहा मातरो लोकमातरः । शान्तिः पुष्टि­र्धृतिस्तुष्टिरात्मदेवतया सह</q> शु° त° गृह्यपु° ।</span></li>"
        }
    ],
    "AM_SHS": [
        {
            "word": "मातृ",
            "content": "<li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\"><span lang=\"sa\">मातृ</span>  <div n=\"1\">f. (<span lang=\"sa\">-ता</span>) </div><div n=\"2\"> 1. A mother. </div><div n=\"2\"> 2. A divine mother, the personified energy <lb />of a deity or his wife; in a figurative sense, a mother to mortals; <lb />eight divine Mātris are enumerated, BRĀHMĪ, the Mātri of <lb />BRAHMĀ; MAHEŚWARĪ, the Mātri of ŚIVA; VAISHNAVĪ, of <lb />VISHṆU; AINDRĪ, of INDRA; VĀRĀHĪ, of VISHṆU, as the Varāha <lb />Avatār; KAUMĀRĪ, of KĀRTIKEYA; KAUVERĪ or CHĀMUNDĀ of <lb />KUVERA, and CHARCHIKĀ of ŚIVA, in one of his minor incarna- <lb />tions; another list calls them MAHEŚWARĪ, BRĀHMĪ, NĀRĀYANĪ, <lb />AINDRĪ, VARĀHĪ, KAUMĀRĪ, NARASĪNHĪ, and APARĀJITĀ, differ- <lb />ing from the preceding one in the two last names, the first one of <lb />which, is the energy of VISHṆU in the Narasinha Avatār, and the <lb />latter a form of DURGĀ; another enumeration makes the Mātris <lb />sixteen, and another but seven. </div><div n=\"2\"> 3. A cow. </div><div n=\"2\"> 4. A female of the Brāh- <lb />mana tribe, or the wife of a Brāhman. </div><div n=\"2\"> 5. The earth. </div><div n=\"2\"> 6. A name of <lb />LAKSHMĪ. </div><div n=\"2\"> 7. A name of REVATĪ. </div><div n=\"2\"> 8. Space, ether.</div><div n=\"E\"> E. <span lang=\"sa\">मान</span> to res- <lb />pect, Unādi aff. <span lang=\"sa\">तृच्,</span> and the final of the radical rejected.</div></li>"
        }
    ],
    "AM_MW72": [
        {
            "word": "मातृ",
            "content": "<li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\"> <span lang=\"sa\">मा/तृ</span>   <span class=\"lex\">m.</span> (for  <span lang=\"sa\">मातृ/</span> <span class=\"lex\">f.</span> See <span>p. 807, col. 1</span>) a measurer,<cite>Nir. xi, 5</cite></li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  one who measures across or traverses, <cite>RV. viii, 41, 4</cite> (<abbr>cf.</abbr> 10)</li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  a knower, one who has true knowledge, <cite>Cat.</cite></li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  <abbr>N.</abbr> of a <abbr>partic.</abbr> caste, <cite>ib.</cite> (<abbr>w.r.</abbr> for <span lang=\"sa\">माडव</span>?)</li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  of an author, <cite>Bṛh.</cite></li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\"> <span lang=\"sa\">मातृ/</span>   <span class=\"lex\">f.</span> (derivation from √  <span lang=\"sa\">मा</span> very doubtful; for  <span lang=\"sa\">मा/तृ</span> See <span>p. 804, col. 2</span>) a mother, any mother (applicable to animals), <cite>RV.</cite> &amp;c. &amp;c. (sometimes <abbr>ifc.</abbr>, <abbr>e.g.</abbr> <span lang=\"sa\">कुन्ती-म्°</span>, having <abbr>K°</abbr> for a mother)</li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  <abbr>du.</abbr> father and mother, parents, <cite>RV. iii, 3, 33</cite>; <cite>vii, 2, 5</cite> (also <span lang=\"sa\">मात/रा-पित/रा</span>, <cite>iv, 6, 7</cite>, and <span lang=\"sa\">पित/रा-मात/रा</span>, <cite>Pāṇ. vi, 3, 33</cite>; <abbr>cf.</abbr> <span lang=\"sa\">मातरपितरौ</span>, <abbr>col.</abbr> 2)</li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  the earth (<abbr>du.</abbr> heaven and earth), <cite>RV.</cite></li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  (with or <abbr>scil.</abbr> <span lang=\"sa\">लोकस्य</span>), a cow, <cite>MBh.</cite></li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  (<abbr>du.</abbr> and <abbr>pl.</abbr>) the two pieces of wood used in kindling fire, <cite>RV.</cite> (<abbr>cf.</abbr> <span lang=\"sa\">द्वि-म्°</span>)</li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  (<abbr>pl.</abbr>) the waters, <cite>RV.</cite> (<abbr>cf.</abbr> <span lang=\"sa\">सप्तम्°</span> and <cite>Naigh. i, 13</cite>)</li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  (<abbr>pl.</abbr>) the divine mothers or personified energies of the principal deities (sometimes reckoned as 7 in number, <abbr>viz.</abbr> <span>Brāhmī</span> or <span>Brahmāṇī</span>, <span>Māheśvarī</span>, <span>Kaumārī</span>, <span>Vaiṣṇavī</span>, <span>Vārāhī</span>, <span>Indrāṇī</span> or <span>Aindrī</span> or <span>Māhendrī</span>, <span>Cāmuṇḍā</span>; sometimes 8, <abbr>viz.</abbr> <span>Brāhmi</span>, <span>Māheśvarī</span>, <span>Kaumārī</span>, <span>Vaiṣṇavī</span>, <span>Vārāhī</span>, <span>Raudrī</span>, <span>Carma-muṇḍā</span>, <span>Kāla-saṃkarṣiṇī</span>; sometimes 9, <abbr>viz.</abbr> <span>Brahmāṇī</span>, <span>Vaiṣṇavī</span>, <span>Raudrī</span>, <span>Vārāhī</span>, <span>Nārasiṃhikā</span>, <span>Kaumārī</span>, <span>Māhendrī</span>, <span>Cāmuṇḍā</span>, <span>Caṇḍikā</span>; sometimes 16, <abbr>viz.</abbr> <span>Gaurī</span>, <span>Padmā</span>, <span>Śacī</span>, <span>Medhā</span>, <span>Sāvitrī</span>, <span>Vijayā</span>, <span>Jayā</span>, <span>Deva-senā</span>, <span>Sva-dhā</span>, <span>Svāhā</span>, <span>Śānti</span>, <span>Puṣṭi</span>, <span>Dhṛti</span>, <span>Tuṣṭi</span>, <span>Ātma-devatā</span> and <span>Kula-devatā</span>; they are closely connected with the worship of <span>Śiva</span> and are described as attending on his son <span>Skanda</span> or <span>Kārttikeya</span>, to whom at first only 7 <span>Mātṛ</span>s were assigned, but later an innumerable number; also the 13 wives of <span>Kaśyapa</span> are called, <span lang=\"sa\">लोकानाम् मातरः</span>), <cite>MBh.</cite>; <cite>R.</cite>; <cite>Pur.</cite>; <cite>Hcat.</cite> (<cite>RTL. 222</cite> &amp;c.)</li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  (<abbr>pl.</abbr>) the 8 classes of female ancestors (<abbr>viz.</abbr> mothers, grandmothers, great-grandmothers, paternal and maternal aunts &amp;c., <cite>Saṃskārak.</cite>; but the word ‘mother’ is also applied to other female relatives and in familiar speech to elderly women generally)</li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  <abbr>N.</abbr> of <span>Lakṣmī</span>, <cite>Bhartṛ.</cite></li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  of <span>Durgā</span>, <cite>L.</cite></li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  of <span>Dākṣāyaṇī</span> in certain places, <cite>Cat.</cite></li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  <abbr>accord.</abbr> to <cite>L.</cite> also = a colocynth</li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  <b>Salvinia Cucullata</b>, <b>Nardostachys Jatamansi</b>, <b>Sphaeranthus Indicus</b></li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  air, space</li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  the lower mill-stone</li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  = <span lang=\"sa\">विभूति</span></li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\">  = <span lang=\"sa\">-रेवती</span> </li> <li class=\"dict-entry mw-entry\"><span lang=\"sa\">मातृ</span>   [<abbr>cf.</abbr> <span>Gk.</span>, <gk>μάτηρ</gk>, <gk>μήτηρ</gk>; <span>Lat.</span> <i>mater</i>; <span>Lith.</span> <i>motė́</i>; <span>Slav.</span> <i>mati</i>; <span>Germ.</span> <i>muotar</i>, <i>Mutter</i>; <span>Eng.</span> <i>mother</i>.]</li>"

    "AM_SHKB": [
        {
            "word": "मातृ",
            "content": "<span lang=\"sa\">मातृ<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>पदविभागः - </b>स्त्रीलिङ्गः<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>कन्नडार्थः - </b>ಜನನಿ /ತಾಯಿ<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>निष्पत्तिः - </b>मान (पूजायाम्) - \"तृच्\" (उ० २-९५)<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>व्युत्पत्तिः - </b>मान्यते पूज्यते<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>प्रयोगाः - </b>\"उमेति मात्रा तपसो निषिद्धा पश्चादुमाख्यां सुमुखी जगाम\"<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>उल्लेखाः - </b>कुमा० १-२६<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><div class=\"h-2\"> </div>मातृ<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>पदविभागः - </b>स्त्रीलिङ्गः<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>कन्नडार्थः - </b>ಬ್ರಾಹ್ಮೀ ಮೊದಲಾದ ಸಪ್ತ ಮಾತೃಗಳು<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>विस्तारः - </b>ब्राह्मी, माहेश्वरी, कौमारी, वैष्णवी, वाराही, इन्द्राणी, चामुण्डा ಇವರು ಸಪ್ತ ಮಾತೃಗಳು।<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><div class=\"h-2\"> </div>मातृ<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>पदविभागः - </b>स्त्रीलिङ्गः<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>कन्नडार्थः - </b>ಭೂಮಿ<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><div class=\"h-2\"> </div>मातृ<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>पदविभागः - </b>स्त्रीलिङ्गः<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>कन्नडार्थः - </b>ಗೋವು<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><div class=\"h-2\"> </div>मातृ<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>पदविभागः - </b>स्त्रीलिङ्गः<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>कन्नडार्थः - </b>ಲಕ್ಷ್ಮಿ<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><div class=\"h-2\"> </div>मातृ<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>पदविभागः - </b>स्त्रीलिङ्गः<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>कन्नडार्थः - </b>ದುರ್ಗಾದೇವಿ<div class=\"h-2\"> </div><b>विस्तारः - </b>
